column5: Is there any place in late September a guy could buy leeches? Prefer it to be in a town in hwy 105 because that's our route to red lake. Thanks in advance.

Greetings, Finding leeches at this time of the year is a long stretch, as the leech season is pretty much (if not completely) over. Many places of business were out of leeches when I arrived in Canada almost three weeks ago. I did find some leeches at the Great Bear on Hwy 11 east of Fort Frances. A buddy found some at Queen Street Laundry in Dryden. You might also want to check Clark's on Cedar Lake. I wouldn't worry too much if I couldn't find leeches at this time of the year. Walleyes in the lakes that I fish often switch to a minnow bite around the middle of August. Crawlers might be your best backup. Good fishing and tight lines!!

Give Ritchie's a call for your leeches , 807-529-6556, good folks from Iowa . If you need some beer they carry that too. They will be on the left hand side of the road, you will see the sign before the turn. Good luck and happy shopping!
4 seasons in ear falls had plenty of them last week. We always call before our trips and they have what we need ready for us.
Nothing like leeches with a beer chaser.
